comment_13:
It's very clear that this song is about building a piece of IKEA flat pack furniture.

So, it starts with the protagonist saying that he, a man, as social convention would have it (which I don't agree), should be handy with building a piece of furniture, but he is "not good at making a night stand" and is getting "so emotional", he therefore needs "love" (or support) to do it. 

So he called IKEA external contractor to "Stay with me" at his home and by his side to build this "night stand". He keeps calling the contractor "Darling" in reference to "Captain Darling" from Blackadder (Rowan Atkinson) who is always supporting and by the side of General Melchett through the war. 

Obviously, when we build a piece of flat pack furniture, we would logically lay out all the components on the floor, like a puzzle, the last piece could sometimes be a large wooden board or door for, say, a wardrobe. 

This very large night stand (more like a small wardrobe) needed a final piece putting in - its door. So he asks the contractor, "but you can lay with me so it doesn't hurt". Just don't forget, a lot or people suffers from a bad back and 2 is better than 1 when trying to lift, lay and secure a large wooden door to the wardrobe hinges.

comment_15:
I dated a girl, We had a very good connection from the first time we met.
We had a few magical nights together, and I started developing feelings toward her. 

The last time we met, I remember us cuddling in my bed, talking about how we see this relationship from our point of view. 
Eventually, very maturely and with a lot of recpect, we both understood our values are too different, and the way we see our future is way more different. We understood it was the time to say goodbye.

She asked me if I want her to leave but I said no. I didn't want to, after all this time feeling lonely, I wanted to feel loved for one night , even if that means that I will think about it afterwords with tears in my eyes. 

So she stayed. 
After she left, that song crossed my mind. I felt every word.

This is a sad story, but I am thankful for this experience of being loved once again.

Wishing us all to feel loved and whole for the rest of our lives. â¤
